topics.body:
"@Gizoid101":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551cbd1363687246cf570200#post_551cbd1363687246cf570200

_And I'm insensitive, and I lack empathy
He looked at me and said, "Your potential is bittersweet"
I looked at him and said, "Every nickel is mines to keep"
He looked at me and said, "Know the truth, it'll set you free
You're lookin' at the Messiah, the son of Jehovah, the higher power
The choir that spoke the word, the Holy Spirit, the nerve
Of Nazareth, and I'll tell you just how much a dollar cost
THE PRICE OF HAVING A SPOT IN HEAVEN, EMBRACE YOUR LOST, I AM GOD"_

topics.body:
I watched an interview with Neil DeGrasse Tyson and I think I've had a change of heart.
After visiting a facebook page with pictures from the Hubble Space Telescope an leaving a like lots of things dawned on me.

The government isn't so bad. It cares about us so we should respect its authority. 
Individual freedom used for personal gratification is indistinguishable from autonomy and self reliance. I mean we all indulge ourselves al it would be hypocritical to disagree.

Being judgmental is always wrong. If someone wants to be a mage, paladin, or druid then you should not make fun of them, it's the same in real life.
Many times in history people have been hastily judgmental and proven wrong after all.
Don't be hasty. 

And there is nothing more respectable than people whose principles forbid them from ever sticking their hands in the filth to do what is right, risking failure to in tbe process.

And while everyone in the world accepts the truth in these statements, I do think thu should be axioms to live by forever.

Alsl we do need safe spaces for certain groups. Because we all know the people who made a difference in the world didn't beed safe spaces, so inagine how many more great people we will have when we create them?
